summary: A grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Virgin Islands to the Virgin Islands Lieutenant Governor's Office, Division of Banking, Insurance, and Financial Regulations, demanding all records related to the banking business 'SOUTHERN COUNTRY INTERNATIONAL'. The subpoena includes instructions for document production and a non-disclosure request.

persons.name: Gretchen C.F. Shappert
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the District of Virgin Islands who signed the cover letter accompanying the grand jury subpoena, requesting compliance and non-disclosure.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date and time by which the recipient of the subpoena must either produce the requested documents or appear to testify before the grand jury in St. Thomas.

events.title: Subpoena Issued and Served
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued by the court clerk and the date it was served on the Virgin Islands Lieutenant Governor's Office.

locations: Ron de Lugo Federal Building & United States Courthouse, 5500 Veterans Drive, Suite 260, St. Thomas, VI 00801-6421
1108 King Street, Suite 201, Christiansted, St. Croix, VI 00820-5080
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Virgin Islands is investigating suspected violations of federal and territorial criminal laws, as indicated by the subpoena.
The subpoena specifically targets all records pertaining to 'SOUTHERN COUNTRY INTERNATIONAL', a banking business registered in the Virgin Islands.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested the recipient not to disclose the existence of the subpoena or their compliance for 90 days, to avoid impeding the investigation.
The document provides detailed instructions for producing records, including electronically stored information (ESI), indicating a formal evidence-gathering process.
The subpoena number is 2020R00037, linking it to a specific grand jury investigation in 2020.
